title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 June 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:13 <jamie\_\_wiki> Just tested my fix for allowing doc parent change in inline edit mode on my 3.5 install, seems to work fine with minor change (removing withLock class).  
00:14 <jamie\_\_wiki> I've created a pull request against the master here: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/51  
00:39 <+AndreasJonsson> jamie\_\_wiki: I've tested your patch on 4.2-SNAPSHOT and it works fine.  I'll commit it.  
00:39 <jamie\_\_wiki> thanks!  
00:42 <CIA-117> Andreas Jonsson master \* r2dddbdf https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2dddbdfafa3489e60c385dc3baef280819ec255e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/editinline.vm : XWIKI-6935: Patch by jamiemaher - Determine if edit should be allowed earlier, and start html form element just after mainContentArea div if editing is allowed. - http://git.io/C2dfEA  
00:42 <CIA-117> Andreas Jonsson master \* re3f53b6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e3f53b621e83b353d9fb788594f8ff20b0f8c7e1 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/macros.vm : XWIKI-7172: Readding colum name comment in JSON code. - http://git.io/dB-\_jQ  
00:42 <CIA-117> Andreas Jonsson master \* r82938c6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/82938c671fac7e9df44933cb6adf71464d28703a / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7878: Javadoc format cleanup. - http://git.io/zzKXiA  
00:46 <CIA-117> Andreas Jonsson stable-4.1.x \* raebe883 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/aebe88334fa96c6865e2e3a5e827f17183856833 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/editinline.vm : XWIKI-6935: Patch by jamiemaher - Determine if edit should be allowed earlier, and start html form element just after mainContentArea div if editing is allowed. - http://git.io/iC8zlg  
00:53 <CIA-117> Andreas Jonsson stable-3.5.x \* r8a51a3b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/8a51a3baf58fdb25e85f941d03fc382b1486cade / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/editinline.vm : XWIKI-6935: Patch by jamiemaher - Determine if edit should be allowed earlier, and start html form element just after mainContentArea div if editing is allowed. - http://git.io/bgtagg  
01:05 <polx> has quit  
01:23 <Enygma`> has quit  
01:35 <jamie\_\_wiki> Thanks, don't know if anyone wants to take a look at an improvement I did to the AttachmentSelector.  I added support for saving to and listing from a target page. (eg if you want to restrict access to attachments by setting rights on the target page, but still allow access to the main listing/detail page)  
01:36 <jamie\_\_wiki> The pull request is here for that: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/pull/20  
01:37 <jamie\_\_wiki> The last change commited to that pull request also includes a big speedup for pages with many attachments, which could probably be applied to the stock AttachmentSelector: https://github.com/jamiemaher/xwiki-enterprise/commit/d771678cbe1f21c29270fd060f7c532e042df168  
01:39 <jamie\_\_wiki> Eg.  with 262 attachments it took 25 sec before, 5 sec after.  
01:40 <jamie\_\_wiki> Gotta go, thanks.  
01:41 <jamie\_\_wiki> has quit  
02:08 <Shaddox> has joined #xwiki  
02:11 <ssavi> has quit  
02:57 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
03:06 <Shaddox> has quit  
03:20 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:19 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:19 <ssavi> has quit  
04:32 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
05:30 <CIA-117> Jamie Maher master \* rf6867bb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f6867bbd10b98eca614b13aa239f8ed56635390e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-rest/xwiki-platform-rest-server/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rest/DomainObjectFactory.java : XWIKI-7874: wysiwyg: attachments not listing in "link" button "all pages" tab - transport error caused by rest UriBuilderException - http://git.io/RJ-yWA  
05:30 <CIA-117> Jamie Maher master \* r8f3ee0f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/8f3ee0f0193e0aafada2bb631aaf9b9ef4ebc261 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-rest/xwiki-platform-rest-server/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rest/DomainObjectFactory.java : XWiki code style application - http://git.io/NlUZ9g  
06:01 <CIA-117> Caleb James DeLisle stable-4.1.x \* ra749329 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a7493291244423e1d68f22fa2bb3044a0831a499 / (19 files in 3 dirs): [release] updating translations - http://git.io/uAJIRQ  
06:05 <CIA-117> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r3e89b5e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/3e89b5edc3df87ca4ffaf4a57070b17e815cf99b / (19 files in 3 dirs): Merge branch 'stable-4.1.x' (+9 more commits...) - http://git.io/VOJnwQ  
06:11 <CIA-117> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r8ebbac1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/8ebbac145e7e61b1d70ae7d6ee67b2e27285c379 / xwiki-manager-ui/src/main/resources/XemResources/Translations.da.xml : [release] Updated translations - http://git.io/HWxV9g  
06:11 <CIA-117> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r8aadb64 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/8aadb6499e5104c268db05dbd0abf2a5f5cda3cf / xwiki-manager-ui/src/main/resources/XemResources/Translations.da.xml : Merge branch 'stable-4.1.x' - http://git.io/O02lwg  
06:11 <CIA-117> Caleb James DeLisle stable-4.1.x \* r8ebbac1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/8ebbac145e7e61b1d70ae7d6ee67b2e27285c379 / xwiki-manager-ui/src/main/resources/XemResources/Translations.da.xml : [release] Updated translations - http://git.io/HWxV9g  
06:21 <tekzilla> has quit  
06:23 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis1> has quit  
07:03 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <Denis> has quit  
07:32 <ssavi\_> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <ssavi\_> has quit  
07:35 <ssavi\_> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <ssavi> has quit  
07:35 <ssavi\_> is now known as <ssavi>  
08:24 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <vmassol> cjd: please don't release yet, I still need to work on it today  
08:49 <vmassol> for RC1  
08:49 <vmassol> I need to implement support for windows7 for 4.1  
08:49 <vmassol> I'll be done before end of day  
08:49 <@cjd> ok, please send mail to the list so we can agree on a new postponement date  
08:50 <vmassol> we haven't postponed anything  
08:50 <vmassol> the release is still planned for Monday as it has alwasy been  
08:50 <@cjd> so you're asking to take away all of the staging time?  
08:50 <vmassol> see http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
08:50 <vmassol> errr?  
08:50 <vmassol> 4.1 final is planned for 18th of June  
08:51 <vmassol> not 11th!  
08:51 <@cjd> [xwiki-devs] [PROPOSAL] Release process/dates for 4.1-rc-1  
08:52 <@cjd> since we will be deviating from that I think there should be some documentation of how and why :)  
08:52 <vmassol> checking mail  
08:52 <vmassol> but the roadmap is the official place  
08:52 <vmassol> and it says RC1 is 11th and final is 18th  
08:53 <vmassol> ok I think the mail is not enough, I'll reply  
08:59 <rrodriguez> has quit  
09:01 <vmassol> cjd: just sent a reply mail  
09:01 <vmassol> seems I don't understand something  
09:02 <vmassol> and I apologize for reading  quickly your previous mail  
09:02 <vmassol> "[PROPOSAL] Release process/dates for 4.1-rc-1"  
09:02 <vmassol> I didn't think it through  
09:05 <vmassol> cjd: I think caty has raised a blocker too  
09:05 <vmassol> this one: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-7885  
09:07 <@cjd> hmm indeed  
09:08 <vmassol> we need to get hold of Enygma (eddy)  
09:08 <vmassol> pinging him on skype  
09:08 <@cjd> If we are to release without staging as you suggest, we would be going against what seems to be agreed upon here: http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/devs/2012-May/050825.html  
09:08 <@cjd> I should take a tally for correctness.  
09:09 <vmassol> let me re-read this  
09:09 <vmassol> well this mail is not clear  
09:10 <vmassol> it doesn't explain what happens to rc and final  
09:10 <@cjd> "For RC or finals, we place the release in staging and immediately call a VOTE to publish the release, this gives our testing team (everybody!) 72 hours to raise a potential issue."  
09:10 <vmassol> so this means more release time and not less  
09:10 <vmassol> delayed releases  
09:10 <vmassol> but below you say "it is advantageous to move toward a faster release cycle  
09:10 <vmassol> "  
09:11 <vmassol> this does not compute for me :)  
09:11 <vmassol> this means double staging  
09:12 <vmassol> I'm fine to replace our current staging that we do with RC but it needs to be as effective so we need to find way to make it effective. But keeping both is just wasted time  
09:12 <vmassol> and goes in the opposite direction that we want  
09:13 <@cjd> It would be nice if we could figure out how to rename -rc to -final  
09:13 <vmassol> I think nexus should allow that  
09:13 <vmassol> but  
09:13 <vmassol> we would need to implement custom code  
09:13 <vmassol> becuase we're doing tricky stuff with versions  
09:13 <vmassol> like our version.properties file  
09:13 <vmassol> anyway I've never found how to do ti with nexus  
09:14 <vmassol> even though I read somewhere it was possible a few years ago  
09:14 <vmassol> maybe it  was planned but never implemented  
09:14 <vmassol> ATM I doubt it's possible to dit  
09:14 <vmassol> \*do it  
09:19 <vmassol> cjd: shouldn't we apply http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6935 before RC1?  
09:20 <vmassol> ah it's applied already :)  
09:23 <@cjd> lol I just sent mail to close it as I saw your mail come in retracting your vote  
09:23 <vmassol> yep noticed  
09:24 <vmassol> right now I'd like to see if others think like me  
09:24 <@cjd> my feeling about the long staging is it's no concern because we can continue on developing on the next iteration  
09:24 <vmassol> we see the effect here of the new practice  
09:24 <vmassol> we're loosing 4 days of dev  
09:24 <vmassol> re next iteration it's not so simple  
09:24 <vmassol> that would assume there's no urgent need for the feature being developed  
09:24 <@cjd> we lose it for 4.1 but we get it back for 4.2 because this time is added to the 4.2M1 cycle  
09:25 <vmassol> that means 3 months later  
09:25 <vmassol> in my case  
09:25 <vmassol> we're loosing users every day  
09:25 <vmassol> because the window7 installer just doesn't work  
09:25 <vmassol> and people go away  
09:25 <vmassol> it's a blocker bug  
09:26 <@cjd> perhaps a patch for that should be pushed into 4.0.1?  
09:26 <vmassol> yep  
09:26 <vmassol> let me explain  
09:26 <vmassol> I've fixed the installer properly on 4.2 branch  
09:27 <vmassol> while fixing it I realized that the fix is too complex to be ported on the 4.1 branch  
09:27 <vmassol> it's too risky with too many changes  
09:27 <vmassol> so  
09:27 <vmassol> what I'm now going to do today  
09:27 <vmassol> is implement a degraded solution  
09:27 <vmassol> which is to install XWiki at the root of the C drive  
09:27 <vmassol> (on windows7 only)  
09:27 <vmassol> this I can port back on 4.0.1  
09:28 <vmassol> it's not perfect but it's easy to do and will make the installer work  
09:28 <ssavi\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <@cjd> I see how long release cycles make it take longer for changes to get from the developers to the users. We need to balance that against stability of the release.  
09:29 <vmassol> which btw is why I'd like to have 2 weeks release cycle in some future ;)  
09:29 <vmassol> then we can implement true time boxing  
09:29 <@cjd> I'm wary of making changes to the process when we're under the gun to make a time schedule since it's easy to gut due dilligence.  
09:31 <ssavi\_> has quit  
09:31 <ssavi\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <ssavi> has quit  
09:31 <ssavi\_> is now known as <ssavi>  
09:32 <vmassol> btw cjd I need to push previous release to maven central for comons/rendering  
09:32 <vmassol> the RM should have pinged me about it ;)  
09:32 <vmassol> according to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleaseProcess  
09:33 <vmassol> we're missing 4.1M1 and M2  
09:33 <vmassol> will do after I finish the windws7 stuff  
09:33 <@cjd> ahh sorry about that, will add it to my plans.  
09:33 <vmassol> it's listed already  
09:34 <vmassol> you have a checklist in the plans is that it?  
09:34 <@cjd> I've been working off of ReleasePlans which I made into an improved checklist  
09:34 <vmassol> ok  
09:34 <@cjd> if I don't have a checkbox to check, I'm guaranteed to mess it up somehow ;)  
09:35 <vmassol> hmm I don't see a stable-4.1.x branch  
09:35 <@cjd> which project?  
09:35 <vmassol> do I need to git fetch for branches too?  
09:36 <vmassol> (just fetched for tags)  
09:36 <vmassol> enterprise  
09:36 <@cjd> git branch -a  
09:36 <@cjd> git checkout -b stable-4.1.x --track origin/stable-4.1.x  
09:37 <vmassol> thanks  
09:38 <@cjd> I'm actually not opposed to releasing final into staging asap and then testing it out of staging instead of RC if we have a proposal  
09:38 <@cjd> I don't see any reason not to  
09:38 <vmassol> as I mentioned the only issue I have with this is community testing for real  
09:38 <vmassol> a release is mentioned everywhere ont he web  
09:39 <vmassol> on all sites  
09:39 <vmassol> in our download pages  
09:39 <vmassol> etc  
09:39 <vmassol> it has a powerful effect on people to install it and try it out  
09:39 <vmassol> I don't see how we can have such an effect with a staged release  
09:39 <vmassol> which is not yet released  
09:39 <@cjd> hmm ofc there isn't any nice way to get that if we so short releases either  
09:39 <vmassol> and as you say everybody does it  
09:39 <vmassol> the rc thing  
09:39 <vmassol> not the staging  
09:40 <vmassol> re short releases  
09:40 <vmassol> yep that's the main reason we're not doing it yet: we don't have a good enough autimated test suite  
09:40 <@cjd> last minute "hey we decided to skip rc-1" would be no good  
09:41 <+sburjan`> so we'll have the staging on maven next week so I can test stuff ?  
09:41 <@cjd> I guess the only option if you really want to prevent slow releases is to drop staging entirely.  
09:41 <vmassol> sburjan`: you'll have the RC for sure  
09:42 <vmassol> cjd: my point in the emails I've sent this morning  
09:42 <vmassol> otehrwise we need to accept to loose 4-5 more days when we do releases  
09:42 <vmassol> or  
09:42 <vmassol> reduce the RC-final timespan  
09:43 <vmassol> but  
09:43 <vmassol> that's not good  
09:43 <vmassol> users won't have enogh time to install and test it  
09:43 <@cjd> 1. long release, 2. no rc, 3. no staging  
09:43 <@cjd> seems to be it  
09:45 <@cjd> at any rate I think if we're going to make any dramatic change we need at least a proposal  
09:45 <vmassol> cjd: sorry I have to start focusing on the windows7 stuff to finish ASAP  
09:45 <@cjd> ok  
09:54 <+sburjan`> cjd: 4.1 RC1 is in staging while others still have code to commit ?  
09:54 <vmassol> sburjan`: yes, there are also a few blockers (I counted 3)  
09:54 <@cjd> What is in staging now will have to be dropped  
09:55 <+sburjan`> so is there any point for testing it now ?  
09:55 <vmassol> sburjan`: yes (if you're prepared to test again later)  
09:55 <vmassol> the more tests the better  
09:55 <vmassol> if you find some blocking bug now we'll need to fix it  
09:55 <vmassol> while if you wait and find the bugs later we'll need to delay even more  
09:55 <vmassol> but you'll spend more time overall  
09:56 <vmassol> tough decision ;)  
09:56 <vmassol> IMO  
09:56 <+sburjan`> I have to test before I can spot something.  
09:56 <vmassol> you could do a quick test now  
09:56 <+sburjan`> and I'll start testing today  
09:57 <+sburjan`> bbl  
09:58 <vmassol> cjd: just wanted to day that I don't want to be a pain in the \*\*\*. I know it can feel this way but all I'm trying to do is for the best of the project… I'm really sorry though not to have spent more time thinking about this release thing… I apologize for the trouble it gives you  
09:59 <@cjd> ahh no trouble for me myself, I can stage and drop a million times.. I'm just trying to advocate for the project too.  
10:00 <vmassol> yep and that's great, I just don't want any hard feeling to build up  
10:00 <@cjd> Nope, hope I'm not too much of a thorn on your side either.  
10:01 <@cjd> (just enough) <snicker>  
10:01 <vmassol> don't worry, i like people who try to make stuff move forward!  
10:01 <polx> has quit  
10:02 <vmassol> I know I can be a pain (my wife tells me that often enough ;))  
10:02 <@cjd> Me too, I get it from my grandfather.  
10:02 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rbcddf7f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/bcddf7f031d2fe50c56d9513b5aa8b143a844472 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/xe/SpacesTest.java : Fix flickering test. - http://git.io/ICyLfQ  
10:02 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-4.1.x \* r32a142c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/32a142c35f218f628996ec4937f175856a0ca970 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/xe/SpacesTest.java : Fix flickering test. - http://git.io/ODnBlQ  
10:08 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <CIA-117> Vincent Massol stable-4.1.x \* rcaae300 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/caae30034ce1b461deee14a24d73736f169a63fe / (3 files in 2 dirs): XE-1184: Quickfix to make the XWiki Installer work on Windows7 - http://git.io/tufMHw  
10:57 <CIA-117> Vincent Massol stable-4.0.x \* r72624dc https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/72624dc202f898513e90ccf6c79d0c91be1bc541 / (3 files in 2 dirs): XE-1184: Quickfix to make the XWiki Installer work on Windows7 - http://git.io/0O-bew  
11:11 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <vmassol> cjd: done for the windows7 installer for 4.0.1 and 4.1RC1  
11:12 <@cjd> cool  
11:14 <@cjd> re the mail I just sent, I'd like to see some kind of proposal for changing the release process since otherwise we would be making a plan and just not following it.  
11:14 <@cjd> \*changing the 4.1-rc-1  
11:14 <vmassol> I don't get what you mean by changing  
11:14 <vmassol> we've been following the same release process for 6 years  
11:15 <vmassol> and you've just proposed a change recently  
11:15 <vmassol> so for me the change is the new proposal  
11:15 <vmassol> which is still very very new and hasn't been tested yet on any release  
11:15 <vmassol> also for me we're still good in term of dates for 4.1 final  
11:16 <vmassol> which is planned for the 18th  
11:16 <@cjd> we're pretty sure to miss it if we follow our current trend  
11:16 <vmassol> for RC1 yes probably  
11:16 <vmassol> since we have 2-3 blockers  
11:16 <vmassol> ATM  
11:17 <vmassol> for final we can still be good  
11:17 <@cjd> anyway we did agree to a set of dates and a time span and to use staging, IMO we need to agree to stop using that rather than come to an informal agreement on IRC and just don't do what we said we would on the list.  
11:17 <vmassol> staging doesn't guarantee anything  
11:17 <vmassol> look we've just found 3 blockers  
11:18 <vmassol> actually you started staging with a blocker already  
11:18 <vmassol> I'm not sure we should do that  
11:18 <vmassol> but that's a detail  
11:18 <vmassol> whats important now  
11:18 <vmassol> is that we fix the blockers  
11:19 <sburjan> has quit  
11:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:19 <@cjd> I don't want to say one thing and do another, you seem pretty adament that we should not use staging, I'm not arguing with you but I would like to see some formal agreement before we change something mid-stream  
11:20 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <vmassol> I'm fine that you continue staging but we can adjust the timeframe  
11:20 <vmassol> and you need to retsage all the time  
11:20 <vmassol> (more work)  
11:21 <vmassol> it doesn't change a single thing from before  
11:21 <vmassol> we were just not calling it staging  
11:21 <vmassol> but we were doing the same work  
11:21 <@cjd> pushing directly to maven.xwiki?  
11:21 <vmassol> ie finding blockers, stabilizing  
11:21 <vmassol> nope, before the push  
11:22 <vmassol> the only difference is that we were not publihsing anything during the stabilization  
11:22 <vmassol> so all is good ATM  
11:23 <vmassol> we just need to fix blockers ASAP  
11:23 <vmassol> so that we can release RC on Monday or Tuesday
